headline: Jim Cramer Says Boeing Has Likely Reached Its Bottom
summary: The Boeing Company (NYSE:BA) is one of the stocks Jim Cramer recently looked at. headline: The Week in Numbers: Thanksgiving sales surge, Disney's China record
summary:
STORY: From a Thanksgiving holiday sales surge to a Disney film breaking Chinese records...

This is the Week in Numbers.

:: Week in Numbers

:: $44 billion

$44 billion was how much U.S. shoppers spent online over the Thanksgiving weekend.

Consumers bought up during the five-days from Thanksgiving to Cyber Monday as retail giants like Amazon and Walmart rolled out discounts.

The data came from an Adobe Analytics report.

It showed spending was up 7.7% from a year earlier and beat Adobe's forecast.

:: 10% 

10% is how much Boeing shares jumped after a positive report.

Investors bought in after the planemaker said it expects higher jet deliveries and positive free cash flow next year.

Boeing wants to improve its image after a 5-year corporate crisis involving safety and production issues of its 737 series.

The issues have hit its reputation and sent the U.S. major deeply into debt

:: $1.5 billion

$1.5 billion is how much Prada spent to buy out fellow Italian fashion brand Versace.

Prada had long sought the deal and signed an agreement in April to purchase the decades-old firm from U.S.-based Capri Holdings.

The late Gianni Versace founded his luxury brand known for its glamorous style in 1978.

His sister Donatella stepped down as creative head earlier this year.

:: 10.6%

10.6% was the sales growth rise for Zara owner Inditex in November.

It's a crucial period for retailers due to the Black Friday weekend.

It also confirmed a strong start to the fashion major's biggest revenue quarter.

One analyst said the Spanish company may have its home market to thank due to the country's strong economy.

:: $275.6 million

And $275.6 million was how much Disney's Zootopia 2 made in its first six days of release in China.

That means it has become the highest-grossing animated foreign film ever in the country.

Zootopia 2 made up around 95% of all movie ticket sales over its opening weekend.

It comes just months after Beijing cut the number of U.S. films allowed in China due to its trade war with Washington.
